conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the process of a gas moving from state A to state B in the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle.
The diagram shows a cycle with isothermal processes A→B and C→D.
Identify the process from state A to state B. In the P-V diagram, this corresponds to a process where the gas expands from a smaller volume to a larger volume.
Determine the nature of the process. Since the process is isothermal (constant temperature), the gas will do work on the surroundings. This means the gas absorbs heat from the surroundings.

Since the gas absorbs heat, the temperature of the gas will increase. In an isothermal process, the gas expands, and the volume increases. Therefore, the gas will do work on the surroundings, which means it absorbs heat.
Conclude that the gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
